intro: Schismatoglottis longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed schismatoglottis, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in inflorescences, often resembling those of other orchid species. Schismatoglottis longipes is typically grown as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in humid, warm environments with indirect light.
